title: Demystifying NMO & MOG
description: Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD) and Myelin Oligodendrocyte Glycoprotein antibody disease (MOGAD) are neurological autoimmune diseases that cause blindness and paralysis. While NMOSD and MOGAD are rare diseases, autoimmune diseases are common, and so is finding scientific and medical jargon tricky to understand. In this podcast, The Sumaira Foundation works to simplify the science associated with NMOSD, MOGAD, and related neuro-immune disorders, bringing together patients and experts.

title: The Plague
description:
Welcome to The Plague, the podcast where we look, not just at the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, but at our nation’s home-made plagues, plagues created by human socioeconomic systems, that make the coronavirus more virulent and dangerous.

The coronavirus infects the human body, but what illnesses in our body politic make us more vulnerable to it?

Economic inequality? Environmental devastation? Labor precarity? Alienation? We pick a different societal plague each week and talk with an expert about how that plague makes the coronavirus deadlier.

We then move on to discuss “treatments” or even “cures” for that plague: what kinds of political or cultural action we can take to “cure” it. Since many of our guest experts are also artists, they are invited to share a creative work on the topic—a song, poem, monologue—of their own creation or choosing.

Guests include poet and Friends of the Earth organizer Jeff Conant, Dr. Rupa Marya of the Do No Harm Coalition and the band Rupa and the April Fishes, performance artists Annie Sprinkle and Beth Stephens, theatre activist Aryeh Shell, affordable medicine activist Merith Basey, playwright and San Francisco Mime Troupe member Michael Gene Sullivan, and many more.

Your host, L.M. Bogad, broadcasts from his “shelter in place” bunker, while himself conspiring in ongoing creative activist campaigns on these issues.

The Plague Podcast:

Created, Hosted, Edited by L.M. Bogad (www.lmbogad.com), professor of political performance at UC Davis, and author of the books Tactical Performance and Electoral Guerrila Theatre, and the play COINTELSHOW: A Patriot Act.

Music by Jason Montero (https://m.soundcloud.com/jamoja) and Bogad’s Other Friend Named Jay. Logo by Bogad, with clip art from nicepng.com.

For more information on L.M. Bogad's books and performance work: www.lmbogad.com.

L.M. Bogad is an author, performance artist, professor of political performance at U.C. Davis, and co-founder of the Clandestine Insurgent Rebel Clown Army. He has performed and led workshops in mischievous activist pranks internationally, most recently in Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Latvia, at SFMOMA and other major museums, on a squatted military base in Barcelona, and in Cairo during the first phase of the Egyptian revolution. He was the “Art and Controversy” Fellow, and the Distinguished Lecturer on Performance and Politics, at Carnegie Mellon University, and the “Humanities and Political Conflict” Fellow at Arizona State University. His projects includes a historical role playing game called “Possible Pasts,” and performances which excavate and explore the memories of historical confrontations including the Haymarket Square Riot, the Pinochet coup, and the FBI’s COINTELPRO activities. His books are Electoral Guerilla Theatre: Radical Ridicule and Social Movements, Tactical Performance: The Theory and Practice of Serious Play, and COINTELSHOW: A Patriot Act and the forthcoming Perform/Inform/Transform: Works of Radical Memory for Times of Social Amnesia..

title: The Communiqués Podcasts

The cases are the accounts from completed medico-legal death investigations of the Coroners Courts, and our team of senior medical and nursing practitioners present this information to meet the needs of clinicians. The Clinical Communiqué focusses on acute care, the Future Leaders Communiqué designed for recent health graduates, and the Residential Aged Care Communiqué examines care in nursing homes. title: Precision Opinions Live
description:
Welcome to Precision Opinions Live! A podcast and videocast, hosted by Christian Stella (Pharm D, ABAAHP), that discusses different topics within the pharmaceutical, compounding and medical world. 

Precision Opinions Live is recorded inside the offices of Precision Compounding Pharmacy, located in Bellmore New York. 
Being inside an active pharmacy, we are able to use the podcast and videocast platforms to further assist the pharmacy's customers and partners while being on the front lines of pharmaceutical trends and consumer needs. 

Christian Stella and guests provide information and technical insight to both patients and other professionals, as well as offering an avenue for answering any compounding or pharmaceutical questions submitted to the show anonymously. 

Having previously been a guest on shows like; Optimal Health with Dr. Christopher Calapai on WABC 770am, and the LDN Radio show, Christian Stella has taken the next step in providing you the listener with even more opportunities to expand your understanding of medications and pharmaceuticals, by starting Precision Opinions Live.

"If I can help one patient better understand what they are taking, why something may or may not be providing the results they are looking for or even simply help them use their medication safely and correctly, then Precision Opinions Live has done it's job" says Christian Stella, Pharm D ABAAHP and host of Precision Opinions Live. 

"Sometimes patients or even other industry professionals are unaware of all of the options that are available to them. By bringing in different guests ranging from doctors with large practices to students, there is a greater chance of connecting that one listener struggling with a medical issue, to the medical professional who can better assist them."    

So join us here at Precision Opinions Live, on our journey to a better understanding of how different pharmaceuticals work and a healthier future.
  
The show can also be viewed on our Youtube channel (all links below) and new updates are always posted on our Instagram, Facebook and Linkedin accounts. 




https://www.precisionpharmacy.net
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChoQnIdhY2pUvirfJzowsRQ/featured
https://www.instagram.com/precision_pharm/?hl=en
https://www.facebook.com/precisioncompoundingpharmacy

Precision Opinions Live is produced and directed by Alexander Ratner of evomximages.com

Join us on a journey to bring integrative health to the masses and hopefully we’ll inspire you to start living an integrative lifestyle.

title: Crème de la Crème
description:
Por Joana Nobre.
Sou Farmacêutica, com mestrado em Ciências Farmacêuticas e especialista em Cosmética, tendo feito uma pós-graduação nesta área e ainda outra em Branding e Gestão de Imagem. Tenho um fascínio assumido pela Psicanálise, a Estatística e a Comunicação. Trabalho na Indústria Farmacêutica desde 2005, leciono em diversas Instituições de ensino superior e sou Program Manager de um Curso de Especialização em Dermocosmética. A Cosmética é uma ciência e nela vivem muitas outras. Adoro escrever sobre o tema, sempre com o objetivo de contribuir para a literacia na área. O rigor é a minha imagem de marca. Viajo muito em trabalho e fora dele. Nas minhas viagens e tempos livres, faço fotografia e crio playlists no Spotify. O meu dia favorito é o sábado, quando arranjo tempo para me aventurar em receitas de bolos e passear em família sem horas marcadas. No meu Crème De La Crème mostro-vos que a cosmética tem um futuro muito promissor.

title: Confronting Covid
description: Too often during the course of the COVID-19 pandemic we turn on the news and hear convoluted, vague or non-factual information in regards to multifaceted areas of the pandemic. This leaves the general public with unanswered questions about their bodies, science, finances, and overall way of life. How do vaccines work? What even is a coronavirus? What should I be doing to protect my livelihood and well-being? To answer these important questions and many more, join Layla Ahmadi, an aspiring physician and medical correspondent with a B.A. in Biochemistry and Global Health, to better understand the things about the COVID-19 pandemic they won't talk about on the news. Layla frequently collaborates with guest speakers on episodes who are experts in fields of medicine, public health, finance and many others. Tune in to have your burning questions about everything related to the COVID-19 pandemic answered.

title: My Medicine
description:
My diary in podcast format. Sharing my self love journey with you lovely listeners , and what has helped me along the way. This is not only to document my experiences, but to help others see their superpowers by describing my own. Each episode will be on a topic I think is crucial for those who are on their journey, as well as the guests that have inspired me, and helped me learn those invaluable lessons (when applicable). This is going to be very open and genuine, and I’m not holding anything back. No topic is off limits. This show will also be unedited, one take conversation(s). I’m so very excited that you are willing to take this journey with me. That is what life is all about; the journey, not the destination.

My IG: LizzieBeeLoved

title: The Golf Strong Project
description:
Welcome to The Golf Strong Project!

This podcast is brought to you by Dr. Jackson Taylor and Dr. Tim Rivotto, two Physical Therapists who are changing the world of Golf Performance. 

The goal? Educate the golfing world on strength training, conditioning, rehabbing from injuries, and doing it all without the silly BS that is thrown out there every day. 

The podcast will cover topics from why strength training matters for golfers, how you can get back to the golf course after injury, and why golfers are athletes too. There may be some philosophy, coffee discussion, and musings on how to be the best person you can on and off the golf course sprinkled in here too. 

Subscribe on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtET4590bTCmH7arOMXiXxA/channels 

Be sure to like and comment and let us know what you would like to hear!

title: Music is Medicine - Ask the Experts
description:
Every 3 seconds someone develops dementia. One in three seniors die with Alzheimer's or dementia. Ten million people worldwide have Parkinson's Disease. In our episodes, we chat with experts and professionals in the field of music and the brain. We discuss the exciting new research shedding light on how music affects brain chemistry, bringing joy to seniors! If you know someone with Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, Dementia, or any mental disease, this show is for you! 

Visit our website: https://www.musicmendsminds.org/

title: PubReading
description: Researchers would love if they can expand time to fit in that publication, article, or review of their topic of interest; if that were true, however, there is no end to bottomless scrolling and missing the important details. PubReading would read out the abstract, results, and discussions to allow hassle-free information and a chance to create connections with like-minded individuals.

title: Global Mental Health Outreach
description: In our podcast, we would invite a variety of guests suffering from different mental illnesses to share their journey. Through this podcast series, you will understand how different mental illnesses manifest in people, the range of symptoms these disorders may bring, and how to find hope in recovery. We would also invite professors or psychiatrist to talk about certain mental health or social issues, so that we could learn about them from a professional standpoint.

title: Bioethics in the Margins
description:
Who we are: We are a collaborative of bioethics scholars interested in creating a more inclusive space to explore topics relevant to bioethics and the medical humanities while advancing equity and social change/restitution. Although we found our shared interests through our membership in the American Society for Bioethics and Humanities Race Affinity Group, we are independent of ASBH and any other organization. The views expressed in this podcast are our own and the speakers and do not represent our employers, institutions, or professional societies.

Mission: Bioethics in the Margins aims to include topics, guests and audiences who are not always highlighted in mainstream bioethics discourse. We will focus on structural inequity and the role bioethics can play in social change. We aim to move beyond traditional bioethics frameworks and intentionally draw on intersectionality, social justice, racial justice, disability ethics, women, LGBTQ ethics, and topics specific to Black, immigrant/refugee, Native American, Latinx populations. 

Hosts:  Kirk Johnson, Amelia Barwise

Team Members:

Isabel Bolo, Liz Chuang, Wendy Jiang, Nicolle Strand

title: America's Healthcare Advocate
description:
My name is Cary Hall and I have a strong desire to empower my fellow Americans to cancel out (not add to) the noise and confusion in the US healthcare system by bringing you curated information, a powerful group of healthcare providers, experts, practitioners, authors, and inventors, plus related business and industry leaders for every episode of my show. My goal is to enable you to become an expert in your own healthcare management. It will save your time, save your money, and considerably reduce the effort needed to accomplish it.

Most people, when faced with a medical or healthcare decision, are often in for a complex and uphill battle finding and accessing the options available to them or even sorting through the available options to find the best one for them. I will continue to be a reliable and trusted source for expert-level information and advice about the nuances of healthcare and health insurance and a guide and advocate for every American when making important decisions about their personal healthcare and also when they are a caregiver and helping their spouse, parent, child, sibling or friend.

title: 37Health
description:
٣٧ مئوية ، برنامج يدور في مدار الطب وسيرة الطب، لياليه وأيامه، متاعبه وأحلامه، يحلق حوله لكنه لا يقتصر عليه، ينطلق من مواضيع الطب والصحة إلى ما هو أبعد، الى التجربة الانسانية بعنوانها الأصفى والأرحب. 

ابق على تواصل مع ٣٧ مئوية ولا تنس تفعيل زرّ الاشتراك الموجود في تطبيقك لتصلك الحلقات أولاً بأول.

 

                                                                  


                                                              




 

الحلقة الأولى تقودنا الى شخصية الطبيب والروائي خالد حسيني مبعوث النوايا الحسنة للمفوضية السامية بالأمم المتحدة لشئون اللاجئين.

 

كان من بين ٤٠ مليون نازح، ممن عثر بهم الحظ والجغرافيا والتاريخ، تضيق بهم الأرض، تحشرهم في الممر الأخير.

عندما حطت به الطائرة لاجئا في الولايات المتحدة قبل ٤٠ عاما، لم يكن يعرف الانجليزية. بعدها بسنوات يجد الجالسة الى جواره على الطائرة تقرأ احدى رواياته. يشاهد التلفزيون يوما فيسمع اسمه كجواب صحيح يدلي به متسابق في برنامج مسابقات شهير.

 

هو اليوم روائي شهير طبعت من رواياته أكثر من ٤٠ مليون نسخة.

في هذه الحلقة تتعرفون على خبايا القصة الحقيقية لفتى الشرق النازح.

 

الحلقة الأولى من تقديم: د. أميرة السنوسي و د. رياض سلمان

إعلان الحلقة: الأستاذ والإعلامي القدير عصام سيف

الدبلجة بصوت: الأستاذ محمد الموالي

فكرة وبحث: د. يثرب العالي

مراجعة وكتابة النص: أسرة التحرير

تصميم الشعار: أبرار الحجيري  و حبيب الفردان

التأليف الموسيقي: أحمد الغانم

الإشراف والمتابعة: د. رياض سلمان




المصادر:

 

١- مقال صحيفة التايم في ١٧ مايو ٢٠٠٧ بعنوان " كاتب عداء الطائرة الورقية يعود لوطنه"

 

٢- موقع وكالة اللاجئين بالأمم المتحدة

 

٣- مقال من صحيفة التيليغراف ١٩ مايو ٢٠٠٧ بعنوان " اليأس في كابول"

 

٤- مقال من موقع الإذاعة الأوروبية ٢١ يونيو ٢٠١٢ ، بعنوان : كاتب عداء الطائرة الورقية : عن طفولته ، كتاباته، وقضيته -اللاجئين الأفغان

 

٥- مقابلة مع تيري ديري على برنامج Saturday Live بتاريخ ٢٦ اكتوبر ٢٠١٣

  

 

الهندسة الصوتية والمونتاج       التصميم والميديا           الإعلان والتسويق

title: Friends of Franz
description: Friends of Franz is a space for anyone who loves to learn about all things science, healthcare, and medicine. From relaying their academic journeys to conveying their realizations and tackling field-specific questions where misinformation commonly lingers, the hope is to open the eyes of the public to the daily and humble lives behind well-respected titles, scrubs, and white coats. @friendsoffranzpod @chrsfranz

title: The Silent Battle
description:
Welcome to the Silent Battle Podcast.! 
My name is Erica Jackson Honeycutt, and I will be your host for each segment every other Wednesday at 7 pm central time. This podcast is going to focus on autoimmune diseases and diseases that are thought to have some type of autoimmune relation like my disease Non Specific Interstitial Pneumonia (NSIP). I will be conducting different interviews with people battling their autoimmune disease, and they will be sharing their story and giving us tips on how they manage their symptoms of their disease and how they manage life in general with their disease. 
I want this podcast to represent a safe space for all my listeners because you no longer have to feel like you are battling autoimmune disease alone! We are all in this fight together!~LIFE IS TOUGH BUT SO ARE YOU! ~
LET'S GET STARTED!

title: SCI Science Perspectives
description:
The American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) brings you SCI Science Perspectives. The podcast is built around two-part dialogues with spinal cord injury (SCI) professionals regarding their emerging scientific work spanning the full spectrum of SCI research, from discovery to clinical application. 

The SCI Science Perspectives podcast disseminates the latest-and-greatest scientific work in the SCI field via a conversation with researchers that approaches their work from two perspectives: the “scholarly” perspective and the “community” perspective. The process begins with ASIA’s Committees informing the podcast about new and influential scientific papers relevant to the committee’s interests. Then the podcast host(s) then interview the author(s) of the papers, approaching their project from each perspective. Finally, the conversation from each perspective is published as its own episode type: "Scholarly" and "Community" episodes. Keep an eye out too for "Admin" episodes too, communicating administrative information relevant to ASIA members and stakeholders.

title: My Gut Feelings
description: The answer to most digestive ailments today results from poor choices in our diet,  chronic stress and alterations in the microbiome or gut bacteria. Medical research has drastically changed our understanding of many G.I. diseases. Stomach ulcers are no known to be caused by an infection with H. pylori bacteria. So successful eradication of the infection prevents stomach ulcers from recurring. Bleeding ulcers and esophageal ulceration from acid reflux is rarely seen now with a very potent proton pump inhibitors such as omeprazole. On the other hand autoimmune disease of the bowel such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis is on the increase although biologic agents are now able to alter the disease course so that the overall prognosis is better in these patients. Irritable bowel syndrome is more often diagnosed and its treatment leaves much to be desired. Screening colonoscopy has decreased the death rate from colon cancer. We also have a better understanding of anorectal disease and it's management. I am a professor of Medicine and have been practicing for over 30 years and offer my insights into our digestive wellbeing.
author_name: Waqar Qureshi, MD, FRCP, FASGE, FACG. Professor of Medicine

title: Cultivated Space: DU Native Histories
description: Hello Everyone! I am Reshawn Edison, your host for this series. Cultivated Space reflects my Capstone project as an undergraduate student at the University of Denver Anthropology Department. I explore the reckoning between Indigenous identity In higher education by those who have a relationship with the university. As a predominantly white institution, the University of Denver has upheld an unjust climate within its structure and culture. DU has maintained a hostile academic environment that Native American scholars and their allies constantly struggle with. I highlight these forms of navigation at a collective level. Join me as we validate Indigenous Identity because our relations narrative is critical to making actual change. This project is dedicated to the University of Denver Indigenous community, our allies, and extended relatives. To all my Indigenous peers across Turtle Island in higher education: Our voice, experiences, and stories matter.

title: Toxic History!
description: Toxic History! is a narrative medicine lecture series where medical experts tell you stories from the history of poison. Human beings have known about poison – substances that harm and even kill– for thousands of years. Poisons have been seen as mysterious, supernatural, and enigmatic. What are these plants, mixtures, and elements with such powerful properties? It is only in the past century that science has begun to demystify these chemicals and explain how they work. Still, the impact they have on the world – from cultish mass suicides to chemical attacks to a single case of homicide – can be profound. Toxic History! explores the impact on society, culture, and science behind poisonous events in history.

title: Silent Chemicals, Loud Science
description: Silent Chemicals, Loud Science: a show that takes the "better living" out of chemistry.  We talk to experts from around the globe about what's eating you — chemically speaking — even if you don't know it.  A production of the University of Rhode Island URI Coastal Institute and the University of Rhode Island STEEP Superfund Research Program.      DISCLAIMER: This podcast series was supported, in part, by a grant from the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS) under Award Number P42ES027706. Content is solely the responsibility of the presenters and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences.

title: Psychedelic Frontiers: Bridging Science, Medicine and Consciousness
description:
In recent years, Psychedelics have begun to recapture the attention of the scientific community, largely related to their efficacy in the treatment of neurological disorders including PTSD, depression and addiction. Alongside this, with recent technological advances in neuroimaging, psychedelics may offer an all important tool to further our understanding of consciousness. With groundbreaking studies being released nearly every month, the psychedelic science scene is certainly one you want to keep up to date with!

The Psychedelic Frontiers Podcast features interview-style episodes discussing the science and potential applications of psychedelic and psychoactive compounds with leading academics. By studying these powerful substances, we can gain insight into the nature of consciousness itself, alongside understanding the mechanisms responsible for their profound effects, including those related to mental health. Join us each month for a new episode exploring this fascinating field.

Ben Clayden, the creator and owner of this podcast is currently studying for an MSci in Natural Sciences specialising in Neuroscience at the University of York. Alongside the podcast, he is the co-chair for the Drug Science Student Society Network, as well as the president of his universities Drug Science Society. He has a key interest in neuropsychopharmacology, particularly relating to the neural correlates of consciousness and altered states of consciousness.

Podcast Themes: Psychedelics, LSD, Psilocybin, Magic Mushrooms, MDMA, DMT, Drugs, Science, Medicine, Mental Health, Anxiety, Depression, Consciousness, Biology, Chemistry, Neuroscience, Psychology, Education

title: Diagnexia Dialogues
description:
Diagnexia is an international Pathology Services company with facilities in Chicago, Dublin and Exeter UK. 

Its’ mission is to improve patient experience by improving turnaround time for diagnoses. It helps hospitals balance case workload & remove backlogs by connecting them to a Global Virtual Pathology team via the Diagnexia platform. 

Our podcast series touches on topics like the future of pathology, innovation, digital pathology in particular, impact on practice, use of diagnostic algorithms, pressures/challenges confronting pathology across the world in the next 5-10 years and how do we position ourselves to combat these challenges.

title: The Round Up A Medical Podcast
description:
Welcome to The Round Up, a north Queensland-based medical podcast offering local content for local clinicians. Listeners will hear from passionate and knowledgeable clinicians discussing the approach and management of a diverse range of medical topics of significance to our communities.

Join Dr Elissa Hatherly, a local GP based in Mackay, family planning clinician and Head of James Cook University’s clinical school in Mackay on Yuwi Country. Elissa has 20 years' experience as a doctor in the Mackay region. With clinical work spanning both general practice and the hospital environment, Elissa is particularly interested in preventative health care and improving health literacy in the community. Elissa is also a director of the Mackay Hospital and Health Service Board.

This podcast is currently focused on the region of Mackay and is a collaborative project between the Mackay Hospital and Health Service, local clinicians and JCU where they discuss a range of popular health topics with local experts in each episode. We would like to respectfully acknowledge the Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples of this nation, their contribution to health care and the Traditional Owners of the lands on which we practise.

title: Rare and Share Podcast
description:
Dobro došli na podcast!

Ovo je naše: “Zašto Rare & Share?”: 

Tokom lečenja sina od retke bolesti, a posebno nakon izlečenja imali smo prilike da upoznamo sjajne ljude i čujemo vrlo inspirativne priče. Ceo jedan svet sa svojim temama. 

Ovde ćemo pričati sa onima koji su pokretali lavine događaja, menjali okvire, pomerali granice do tada poznatog. Želimo da razgovaramo o temama koje su važne onima koji se suočavaju sa retkim izazovima kao što su pravni i zakonski okviri, aspekat psihološke podrške, medicinska dostignuća i nove studije. 

Planiramo razgovarati sa ekspertima, naučnicima, predstavnicima struke, razmenjivati argumente bazirane na činjenicama i zvaničnim podacima. Navedenim temama sa gostima, prilazićemo iz pozicija pacijenata, lekara, farmaceuta, države i svakog drugog ugla koji nam se učini važan.
Želimo da teme u vezi sa retkim bolestima približimo ćiroj publici. 

Znamo i kako.
Važno je deliti saznanja, informacije, iskustva.

Esto es VIDA, el podcast de DAVID CABA en el que platicamos sobre el pensamiento científico, las ciencias de la salud y su interacción con la vida diaria. 
Con su experiencia, el doctor Caba nos habla de medicina, cáncer, cirugías, deporte de alto rendimiento, espiritualidad, salud pública, música, literatura, filosofía y mucho más.
¡Bienvenidos, esto es VIDA!

title: Only The Best Herbs with Ryan Bolda - Surgens, LLC
description:
Welcome!

A show by: Surgeons, LLC

Host: Ryan Bolda

Only the best herbs

We want to highlight important people pioneering the way to all natural medicines.

We want to empower people to use all natural products in lieu of dangerous prescription drugs.

🌱 Why 'Only the Best Herbs'?

In a world filled with synthetic solutions, 'Only the Best Herbs' brings you back to nature's embrace. Our show dives deep into the heart of all-natural wellness practices, from the transformative power of cannabis to the soothing essence of honey. We're not just talking about herbs; we're advocating for a healthier, more sustainable future.

🌟 What Makes Our Show Special?

  1. Diverse Herbal Knowledge: We explore a vast array of herbs, including cannabis, microbials, camphor, honey, and many more, unveiling their hidden potentials.
  2. Grow Your Own Medicine: We don't just inform; we empower! Our show encourages and guides viewers on growing their own natural medications, ensuring purity and potency.
  3. Backed by Science: With references from reputable sources like PMC, our content is not just anecdotal but scientifically validated.

⏰ The Time is NOW! The natural wellness revolution is on the horizon, and 'Only the Best Herbs' is leading the charge. But we can't do it alone. We need YOUR support to continue bringing this invaluable knowledge to the world.

title: The FIGO podcast
description: The FIGO podcast, hosted by the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO), aims to disseminate clinical recommendations to obstetricians, gynaecologists and other health care professionals to help improve women and girls’ health outcomes around the globe. FIGO has a vision that women of the world achieve the highest possible standards of physical, mental, reproductive and sexual health and wellbeing throughout their lives. FIGO is dedicated to the reduction of disparities in healthcare available to women and newborns, as well as to advancing the science and practice of obstetrics and gynaecology. In this podcast, we often use the terms “woman”, “girl” and “women and girls”. We recognise that not all people who require access to gynaecological and obstetric services identify as a woman or girl. All individuals, regardless of gender identity, must be provided with access to appropriate, inclusive and sensitive services and care.

description: Project N95 is a national non-profit working to protect people and their communities during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. Through our shop, we provide equitable access to affordable, authentic N95 respirators, KN95 and KF94 masks, kids masks, COVID-19 tests, and other products. Through our advocacy, education, and distribution of vetted goods and services, we strive to keep everyone safe and informed.

title: Tu Alivio para la Saud
description: ¡Bienvenidos a este espacio, nos complace compartir información valiosa sobre cómo cuidar tu columna vertebral y mejorar tu salud en general. Somos Tu Alivio Quiropráctico, un equipo especializado en el tratamiento de padecimientos relacionados con la columna vertebral de forma natural, sin medicamentos ni tratamientos invasivos. A través de este espacio, compartiremos consejos prácticos y recomendaciones para cuidar tu columna y mantener un estilo de vida saludable. Nuestro objetivo es brindarte herramientas y conocimientos que te permitan lograr una vida más sana y llena de energía.

title: Health Creators
description:
I never dreamed of being a CEO... instead, I studied endless nights to become a Neuroscientist. This was how I would create change in healthcare. In reality, I was a terrible fit for academic research. I remember my old boss telling me 'the change you want to see in a day, you're not going to see in my lifetime or yours....' My first non-academic job was at a biotech startup turning psilocybin into a medicine for depression. Things moved different: closer to my pace. I also saw areas where tech could make things much faster and more efficient. I was inspired and built a company to improve how we develop medicines today: Neuroute. In growing this company (government-backed, VC-backed) over the last 3 years, I've met thousands of people with different backgrounds and inspiring visions of the future. This is my way of sharing what I learn from Creators building the Health of tomorrow. This is Health Creators, I’m Livia Lifes. Let's make healthcare better in this lifetime.

Neuroute - copilot for clinical trials https://www.neuroute.co

Twitter (https://twitter.com/livialifes)

Linkedin (www.linkedin.com/in/livialifes)

title: PCHD EMS Podcast
description: Parker County Hospital District EMS Podcast. Everything and anything related to Parker County's EMS Service. Here we will discuss our current protocols, procedures, and programs with some of the best leaders in the industry.

title: Insight - Salud Mental Integral
description: Espacio dedicado abordar temas de salud mental protagonizado por el Dr. Walter Villalobos y la Dra. Alejandra Zepeda

title: The Gum Guru
description: The Gum Guru Podcast with Dr. Macon Singletary will teach you everything you need to know to keep your teeth and gums healthy. Tooth and gum health are important to your overall health, and Dr. Singletary can tell you how. Each podcast will focus on a different topic. Check back every third Thursday of the month for the latest episode.

title: The PreHealth Podcast
description: The PreHealth Podcast was developed to help all PreHealth students on their journey to acceptance. Our goal is to share information our students need to succeed, connect them with resources, answer questions, and make this stressful process just a little easier. Our episodes will vary from a little over 5 minutes to around an hour in length. Tune in to our shorts on your walk between classes, and when you have more time you can enjoy one of our longer episodes.

title: Oncology Hour
description: Oncology Hour is a live podcast series that addresses common questions and topics in the cancer community such as cancer treatment options, clinical trials, overview of cancer types, and more featuring Massive Bio team members and Oncology experts. Oncology Hour is hosted by Massive Bio, whose mission is to provide all people with equal access to leading edge therapies and new-emerging clinical trials, regardless of where they live or their ability to pay. Massive Bio is a central hub that connects patients to the best treatments and clinical trials available. Massive Bio's team and technology work together to provide a space dedicated to connecting each patient with the best treatment for them.

title: Logopedia Logarte
description:
Seguramente, Logopedia es de esas profesiones que a nadie se le ocurre preguntarse: ¿Qué es?
Te reto a adentrarte 20 minutos, de tu vida, para ir descubriendo lo que Logopedia te aporta y lo que yo te voy aportar, con; anécdotas, tips, vida personal, preguntas y más
Bienvenida, bienvenido a mi rincón personal Logopedia con Silvia V.G.

title: Epi-Center Podcast
description:
Hello and welcome to Epi-Center! My name is Camila Foy, and I am a college student looking to further my education in the medical field. In this podcast, I talk about various topics, all regarding epilepsy. Whilst I do not have epilepsy myself, I hope to spread awareness and educate myself and others about this disorder. As well as this, I wish to eliminate stigma. In the YouTube Channel, you can see video formats of the interviews I conduct and other resources available to you!

*Disclaimer* I am not a medical professional. Any and all information on this podcast is researched by myself. My goal is to become better educated in this field of research, but I am not a certified medical professional. The information discussed is purely research from online and book sources. This podcast should not be used to make diagnoses. Please enjoy!

title: Cardio Pod: Heart of the Matter
description: Introducing Heart of the Matter Cardio Pod. High-level conversations to foster conversation, collaboration, and communication around the ecosystem of cardiovascular research.

title: Solving the Obesity Medicine Puzzle
description: Carrie Warren FNP, a certified medical weight loss provider with years of real world clinical success in weight loss treatment/management, will provide you with inspirational stories and enlightening facts behind the science of obesity management - all from the prospective of promoting health and wellness in the clinic setting. Carrie will debunk some old myths and set the record straight using evidence based practice and share with you how you can achieve success in promoting your health and wellness. As a provider, there is nothing more satisfying than to have someone give you a great big hug and truly thank you for helping them! You as a patient or provider will want to learn how to achieve success towards better health. Contact: Carrie@RemoteMedicalWellness.com Bio: Carrie Warren’s medical background started with receiving her RN degree and license in 1991. She specialized in pediatrics for 14 years, with the last 5 as a Pediatric ER Nursing Supervisor before moving to Alaska. She then moved on to become the Acute Care Director for a rural critical access hospital where she discovered her passion for teaching and continued learning. In order to support her new found passion, she transitioned into the roll of Education Director for a larger hospital where she provided a variety of continued education to medical staff. Since then, she continues to educate her patients, providers, and community with more of an obesity focussed curriculum. In early 2009, she completed her advanced degree as a Family Practice Nurse Practitioner and began practicing medicine as a provider where she discovered the critical need for a better way to help her patients deal with a multitude of health issues - ultimately exacerbated by their obesity. Recognizing there is actually a nation wide epidemic of obesity she decided to be proactive instead of reactive. To start REALLY making a difference, in 2016 Carrie took it upon herself to create a medical weight loss program in rural Alaska. The first step is for her to stop just treating symptoms and start treating obesity as the disease. Starting with extensive research, adding additional personal education, going to specialty conferences, becoming recognized for her additional education and knowledge base she now has a thriving and very successful medical weight loss program. She has helped hundreds of people achieve weight loss, but more importantly achieve health and wellness. Often being asked out side the office for advice. She realized that to really influence and help others, she needs to continue to speak up to a wider audience. Creating this Podcast does just that, and will demystify some misconceptions that were once thought to be true regarding obesity management. Carrie is going to share her wisdom and clinical experience along with all the tidbits of knowledge she has learned over the years. Her fun personality, compassion, professionalism, and spunkiness has helped so many people do the happy dance out of her office!

title: Naukowo, w prostych słowach
description: Cykl podcastów "Naukowo, w prostych słowach” to propozycja dla Wszystkich, którzy szukają solidnej dawki wiedzy, popartej badaniami naukowymi i podanej w ciekawej formule. W naszych podcastach chcemy rozmawiać przede wszystkim o zdrowiu domowych pupili i wszystkim, co zdrowia dotyczy.

title: عِلْم
description:
اسمي محمد صادقلي، طبيب أسنان، أعيش في كندا، في هذه الأيام أصبح الحصول على المعلومات سهلاً، ولكن نسبة السهولة تتناسب عكساً مع الدقة
سأناقش المعلومات المنتشرة على وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي بعد أن قمت بالبحث عنها بشكل علمي..
محققاً بذلك شغفي بالبحث عن الحقيقة وفي نفس الوقت أضيف بعض المتعة على المعلومات الجافة لتصبح سهلة الاستماع والاستمتاع لكم... شكراً لوجودكم هنا ...

title: Heme Consults: For Women of Color in Hematology
description: Dear woman of color in hematology, Heme Consults is your personal space to rest, recharge, and renew your spirit with a weekly infusion of inspiration from hematologist, Dr. Toyosi Onwuemene. Every Sunday, Dr. Onwuemene will remind you that you are a superstar and have everything you need to succeed in your incredible career as a hematologist. Welcome to the hematology sisterhood that will transform your world.

title: DERM of the Day
description:
Created by a third-year osteopathic medical student to educate premed and medical students about some of the most commonly tested dermatologic conditions encountered in medical school, as well as foster relationships within the Dermatology community.

***For educational purposes only, not intended to be used as medical advice***

title: Pre-Med Uncultured
description: Welcome to Pre-Med Uncultured! We are a collaborative group of pre-medical students seeking to share experiences and knowledge in order to climb the pre-med ladder together. Join co-hosts, Kate McKay and Chuka Onuh, twice a month to escape the toxic pre-med environment.  Our goal is to cultivate a countercultural movement of information-sharing instead of information-hoarding.  Join us to hear from students across the world share their paths to medicine, and together we will weed through the weedouts. We want to hear from you all! Follow and DM us on social media; hit us up with potential topics to discuss and share your pre-med stories. Welcome to our pre-med community!         Follow us on Instagram:                                                                                            Podcast: @premeduncultured                                                                                          Kate McKay: @ktkmck                           Chuka Onuh: @chukaonuh

title: The Dr. Gil Show
description: The Dr. Gil Show is a weekly podcast hosted by Dr. Gil Wilshire, MD, a board certified Reproductive Endocrinologist with a private practice, Missouri Fertility, in Columbia, Missouri.

title: The COVID-19 Pandemic and What it Taught Us: Collective Trauma and Moving Forward
description: In this eight-episode series, we'll hear about the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on our mental health and wellbeing and what we learned from this unprecedented experience of collective trauma and challenges. Listen to hear HOP's staff talk with experts from various fields of mental health, healthcare, education, and advocacy about our collective experience with the COVID-19 pandemic and what it might all mean as we process, try to heal, and move forward together.

title: Thursdays@3 by Palliative Care Australia
description:
Join us as we open up the conversation about the last taboo - death and dying. We know it's a difficult conversation to have with yourself and your loved ones, but it's a crucial and empowering one to have.

Whether you're someone who works in palliative care, have a loved one going through palliative care, are bereaved, or if you're the one living with a life limiting illness this podcast is for you.

We will be talking to experts from the field and people living and working at the end of life.

You only die once, so let's do it right...

title: Les Piluliers
description:
Les Piluliers, une baladodiffusion améliorant la compréhension de votre médication!

Nous avons développé ce balado pour encadrer davantage l’ensemble des patients dans la prise en charge de leurs problèmes de santé. À l’image d’un pilulier, nous espérons que cette baladodiffusion vous sensibilisera davantage quant à la prise de vos médicaments (et limitera les oublis !).

Veuillez noter que les épisodes et leur contenu ont été révisés par Sandrine Vézina, pharmacienne, avant leur publication.
author_name: Émile Bergeron, Gabriel Couture et Émile Gilbert

title: DNA&
description:
Unlock the secrets of the genomics revolution with the "DNA&" podcast! Join Imperial College scientists Hannah & Angelos to explore the impact of DNA on personalised healthcare. Designed for non-experts and sponsored by the UK Genetics Society.

Music by Auburn Jam Music LTD www.auburnjam.co.uk and artwork by Nikos Kabasele https://www.facebook.com/Kabasele.Nikos

title: Prehospital Care Research Forum
description:
The UCLA Center for Prehospital Care established the Prehospital Care Research Forum at UCLA in 1992 in cooperation with Jems Communications. The mission? To promote, educate and disseminate prehospital research conducted at all provider levels to advance and challenge the future of EMS.

Comprised of respected members of the national and international EMS community, Prehospital Care Research Forum at UCLA Associates represents clinicians, educators, and representatives from state and local governments, public and private sector EMS providers, and manufacturers providing equipment to the prehospital industry.

title: The Thursday Talk: A Coder And A Clinician
description: Historically the clinical and business side of medicine had two separate goals; patient care versus financial stability. In today’s world, there is no reason the two can't speak the same language. The Thursday Talk: The Coder and The Clinician opens the dialogue between these two worlds to benefit the patient, the provider, and the bottom line.

title: Girl Boss and The Gay
description:
Welcome to Girl Boss and The Gay! 
We are here to make you laugh, talk about popular culture, healthcare, and real life. 
Enjoy the shenanigans!

title: Fermentation and Health Speaker Series
description: The Center for Human Microbiome Studies at Stanford University School of Medicine presents Fermentation and Health Speaker Series, led by Elisa Caffrey, David Zilber, and Dr. Justin Sonnenburg. The goal of this series is to create space to have nuanced conversations around the current understanding and knowledge gaps of fermented food research, and act as a platform to define and promote future fermented food and health projects.
author_name: Elisa Caffrey, David Zilber, and Justin Sonnenburg

title: InteropTalk
description: InteropTalk is a monthly discussion with a regular lineup of experts and the occasional special guest to talk about the interoperability landscape, data sharing, patient access to data, government initiatives such as the Trusted Exchange Framework and Common Agreement (TEFCA). Dave Cassel, Health Gorilla's Chief Customer Officer and former Executive Director of Carequality, moderates. The regular panel includes Health Gorilla Chief Medical Officer Steven Lane, MD, MPH, Jennifer Blumenthal, Product Director, OneRecord, at Milliman IntelliScript, and Invitate's Lead of Data Stewardship and Data Sharing Deven McGraw.

title: Diverse Conversations Podcast
description: Join podcast host, Aska Patel, on a journey to seek answers to her questions about the future of pharmacy, healthcare, healthtech, and health systems. Featuring global healthcare leaders, innovators, and frontline staff to unravel the complicated world of healthcare in Canada and the United States of America.

title: In gesprek met Louis en Heinz
description: Kuier saam met twee vriende wat aktuele en ongewone kwessies bespreek oor ’n glas wyn - Louis is ’n kliniese sielkundige, skrywer, asook ’n gereelde en bekende stem op radio . Heinz is ’n mediese spesialis, skrywer van boeke en rubrieke, asook 'n kunstenaar. Kom besoek gerus ons webtuiste by https://ingesprek.co.za/

title: ODONTOLOGÍA
description:
He elegido el tema de odontología simplemente porque me encanta la verdad es que antes me daba un montón de asco pero ahora me flipa.


Para ser odontologo  tengo que estudiar el grado de Odontología y para estudiar esta carrera, se necesita una buena nota en la selectividad de la EBAU.

¿Y QUE ES LA EBAU?
Se trata de una prueba que necesitan superar los estudiantes que han finalizado bachillerato para poder acceder a las universidades españolas.
 
¿QUÉ BACHILLERATO HAY QUE ESTUDIAR?
Para ser un buen dentista hay que estudiar el bachillerato de Ciencias de salud y esto tiene un periodo de tiempo de seis años.


¿QUE CARACTERÍSTICAS TIENE QUE TENER UN ODONTLOGO? 
Tener empatía y saber tratar con los pacientes para conseguir que se sientan cómodos y relajados en la camilla. Tener habilidades manuales. Tener capacidad de utilizar una gran variedad de herramientas y equipamientos especializados. Tener paciencia y capacidad de poner atención a los detalles.


¿CUANTO COBRA UN ODONTOLOGO?
Un odontologo puede llegar a cobrar 3.600€
 qué año sería 66.500€ anuales.
 
CUALIDADES DE UN ODONTÓLOGO 
Interés por los problemas del ser humano y disposición para ayudarle.
2.Facilidad para establecer relaciones interpersonales.
3.Destreza manual.
4.Capacidad de observación.
5.Constancia y tenacidad.
6.Buenos hábitos de higiene y estudio.
7.Capacidad de decisión y autocrítica. 

¿QUÉ ES SER ODONTÓLOGO?
El/la odontólogo/a se encarga de mejorar la salud bucal de la población. A través de una sólida formación médica, diagnostica y trata a los y las pacientes sobre afectaciones relacionadas con los dientes, las encías, el tejido periodontal, los maxilares o las articulaciones implicadas.
La Odontología se inició en el año 300 AC con los médicos egipcios los cuales incrustaban piedras preciosas en los dientes.

title: The Doctor's Brew
description: Ever wanted to have coffee with a doctor?

title: Your Mom on Drugs
description: Josh (B.S M.P.H aka son) and Jennifer (B.S Pharm.D aka mom) are a mother and son pair who want to guide you through the world of chemicals, drugs and pharmaceuticals.  Most of the conversations we have center around science and medicine and we felt it would be fun to bring these chats to the world (also it’s an excuse for us to spend time with one another)  We know there is a lot of information about drugs and diseases out there and we want this podcast to be a resource to find friendly, reliable, evidence-based information that can help you, a friend, or a family member with an ailment or teach you something you didn’t know about the wonderful world of drugs.

title: CNUCHS Podcast
description: Join CNUCHS as we meet and discuss health sciences education in all its different forms, as well as set prospective and current students up for success on their journeys into health sciences!

title: Bioengineering Podcast
description: With the support of the UCSD Bioengineering Graduate Society (BEGS), join us as we delve into the cutting-edge world of bioengineering, life sciences, and health technology, exploring the latest developments and their impact on improving human health and wellness.

title: 7 Things EMS
description:
Would you like to put in your headphones and get fluff-free, conversational CE? The 7 Things EMS podcast gives you exactly that, covering a variety of topics that truly make you a better provider. Your host Dan Limmer talks with industry leaders and experts to give you a fast-paced but deeply insightful podcast that matches any attention span.

Each episode delivers 7 Things you need to know about that topic. Pick and choose which topics interest you. There’s no boring content, no complex paperwork and no membership.

Get CE for listening! Each episode is 1 hour of CAPCE-approved F3 CE. Purchase at https://LimmerEducation.com/7Things

title: TOC Talks
description: TOC Talks is a weekly podcast hosted by The Oxford Center, a medical center located in Brighton and Troy, Michigan. In our podcast, you can hear the personal stories of some of our patients and their journey with The Oxford Center, learn more about how some of our services can benefit different conditions from professionals in their field, discover new techniques and tips to help improve your life, up and coming research on hard-hitting subjects, and more! TOC Talks will be hosted on all of your favorite audio and podcast platforms like as well as a video podcast airing on YouTube and Facebook. Make sure to tune in!

title: LA SALUTE: DAL MEDIOEVO AD OGGI
description: Gli alunni della classe 3As del Liceo "Simone-Morea" presentano un viaggio alla scoperta della crisi del Trecento, della concezione medievale della malattia, della scuola medica di Salerno e dell'art. 32 della Costituzione Italiana.
author_name: Amodio G., Berardi F., Boccuzzi M., Conenna M., Lippolis M.G., Mauro M.

title: Eye Views
description: Conversations on seeing and sight loss, released by Eye News magazine in conjunction with the University of Edinburgh. Hosted by Professor Baljean Dhillon, covering a wide and diverse range of topics related to ophthalmology, optometry and more.

title: Behind the Evidence
description:
“Behind the Evidence” is the addiction medicine podcast of the Grayken Center for Addiction at Boston Medical Center, and a project of the free bimonthly newsletter Alcohol, Other Drugs, and Health: Current Evidence (AODH). It is hosted by Honora L. Englander, MD and Marc R. Larochelle, MD. Each episode offers thoughtful discussion of one or more recent significant publications in the clinical addiction literature. Learn more at www.aodhealth.org.

“Behind the Evidence” is supported by the Grayken Center for Addiction at Boston Medical Center. It is intended for educational purposes only, and should not be considered medical advice. The views expressed here are our own, and do not necessarily reflect those of our employers or the authors of the articles we review. All patient information has been modified to protect their identities.

title: UNSW Exercise Physiology Journal Club
description: Everything you need to know to be a skeptical and curious clinician

title: Hablando de Homeopatía
description:
Hablando de Homeopatía nace como UNA RESPUESTA A LA DEMANDA CRECIENTE DE INFORMACIÓN FIABLE, VERAZ Y RIGUROSA SOBRE LA HOMEOPATÍA por parte de profesionales y pacientes.

5 MÉDICOS
Reflexionando sobre la homeopatía para mejorar el bienestar y la salud de las personas, ofreciendo una información fiable.

title: Hormonal
description: Since the dawn of time, the hormones in your body have been like an intricate, complex friend group fighting to protect you. There are the impulsive ones, the happy ones, the always-hungry ones, and the ones that make you feel all the love. They've got personalities just like us—ones that we haven't taken the time to understand enough. Join Zarah Khondoker as she questions the chemicals behind the madness—and everything it means to be human.

title: HER Talks
description:
Women are the cornerstone of the family unit and communities at large. When we give women in under-resourced geographies the tools they need to survive and thrive, the benefits clearly extend to their children, families, and nations as a whole. Join HERhealthEQ for HER Talks, a conversation with innovators, researchers, healthcare professionals, philanthropy experts, and more. Together, we will discuss why women's health matters now, and how we can come together to achieve global women's health equity. HERhealthEQ is a global nonprofit focused on deploying medical equipment to improve women's health in underserved regions worldwide.

To learn more, visit www.herhealtheq.org/her-talks

title: Handy Essentials for Hand Nurses
description: A podcast geared towards Nurses managing the care and treatment of patients with hand injuries or conditions. By Kay, Hand Clinical Nurse Consultant and Nav, Hand Surgeon Sydney Hospital Hand Unit

title: PharmBUDs
description:
PharmBUDs, created by PharmD students Sierra and Liz, is an interview-led podcast hoping to spark curiosity in prospective and current pharmacy students through candid conversations. Guests from diverse areas of pharmacy expertise share their narratives to inspire a passion for pharmacy aimed at advancing the future of the profession.

Sierra and Liz are “buds” or friends so it seemed important to emphasize that their relationship first budded in pharmacy school. BUDs; however, stands for beyond-use dates. The beyond-use date of a prescription represents the last day the product can be used safely by the patient. Similar to expiration dates, these BUDs are assigned to pharmaceutical products that are manufactured on a smaller scale.

title: Biotech Banter
description: Biotech Banter is hosted by BioCentriq, a highly collaborative CDMO focused exclusively on cell and gene therapy and supporting all stages of process development and clinical manufacturing. This podcast explores the challenges and opportunities of advancing cell and gene therapies to clinic. Hear the perspective of a wide range of contributors ranging from C-level executives to manufacturing operators and more. With expert insights, tips, and information, you'll discover what it takes to set the stage for successful clinical manufacturing, how to decide if working with a CDMO is the right move for your project, how to get the most out of your partnership with a CDMO, and more.

title: Utah Butterflies
description: Ladies in Utah discussing their struggles and successes with Turner Syndrome!

title: Global Nurse Ed
description: Nursing education anytime, anywhere, for anyone...breaking the complex down into the comprehensible. Let my decade-plus experience in nursing education be the supplement to your success with short podcasts you can listen to in the car, at the gym, or anywhere that finds you ready to maximize your potential!
author_name: Jason Micheal Kiernan, PhD, RN, ACNP (United States credentialed)

title: Se Vale Preguntar
description:
La salud mental incluye la forma en que nos sentimos, pensamos, nos comportamos, cómo manejamos el estrés y cómo tomamos decisiones a lo largo de nuestra vida. Así, el estilo de vida y la salud mental están íntimamente ligados al bienestar.

"Se Vale Preguntar", al ser fundado por entusiastas de la salud mental, busca promover la comprensión de este y muchos otros conceptos relacionados con el estado mental.

title: Stories Behind the Mask
description: A podcast created by EMS and fire personnel for the first responder community. Topics may vary from first responder topics to the most outlandish things on this planet. We will plan to upload every other week.

title: Wir erleben anders
description:
Dieser Podcast bietet Eltern, Betroffenen, Fachpersonen und anderen Zuhörer*innen viele Informationen zum Thema Autismus-Spektrum. Ein besonderer Fokus wird dabei auf Kinder im Autismus-Spektrum und Hilfestellungen für deren Umfeld gelegt. Wir sprechen mit Fachärzt*innen, Therapeut*innen, Selbstbetroffenen und deren Eltern unter anderem über die Diagnostik, Behandlung und den Alltag von und mit Kindern im Autismus-Spektrum.

Das Autismuszentrum Sonnenschein bietet für Kinder im Autismus-Spektrum unterschiedliche, auf das jeweilige Kind zugeschnittene Therapieangebote. Das interdisziplinäre Behandlungsteam bestehend aus den Fachrichtungen Medizin, Psychologie, Musiktherapie, Ergotherapie und Logopädie ist speziell für die Arbeit mit Kindern im Austismus-Spektrum ausgebildet. Ihr Wissen stellt das Team nun in unserem Podcast zur Verfügung.

Egal ob Sie bereits viel über das Autismus-Spektrum wissen oder sich ganz neu mit dem Thema auseinandersetzen wollen - wir sind überzeugt unser Podcast hat für alle etwas zu bieten und wünschen viel Spaß beim Hören!

Weitere Informationen zu unserer Arbeit finden Sie unter www.autismuszentrum-sonnenschein.at

Ein Transkript des Podcast steht unter https://rss.com/podcasts/autismuszentrum-sonnenschein/ zur Verfügung.

title: Life On Semaglutide
description: During this Podcast Kody and Krystal will take you on there adventure of obtaining, using and everything in between of this new weight loss drug called Semaglutide.

title: Radiant Living
description: Welcome to the Radiant Living Podcast! Joining you are your hosts Dr. Jessica Kooima and Hailey Adamson. We are passionate about helping people reclaim their health through mind, body, and spirit all from a Christian approach. We hope to encourage you with stories and testimonies and guide you to living a radiant life!

title: Fixing Healthcare...From The Trenches
description: As an orthopedic surgeon with three decades of experience and the founder of OrthoNOW® clinics in South Florida, I wrote the book "Healthcare From The Trenches" from a doctor’s perspective to shed light on the incredible problems I see every day in getting patients the care they need. Why is this important ? * The U.S. healthcare system is in crisis. We are facing skyrocketing healthcare costs, lack of patient access, and inefficient delivery, which has been further amplified by the coronavirus pandemic. The book illustrates the inherent shortcomings in the U.S. healthcare industry and proposes solutions and suggestions for actions every one of us can take to enact positive, long-lasting change. It’s time for every American to understand and be educated about the root causes of our healthcare crisis and demand meaningful reform to improve healthcare efficiencies in America. So join us on this podcast as we delve deeper into FIXING Healthcare from the Trenches with a new guest for every episode.

title: Solutions OP Clinical Trials UK
description: This podcast is dedicated to clinical trials and clinical research. We will be discussing different hot topics and analysis of the latest developments in clinical trials in pharmaceutical and medical devices industries.

title: YouthTeensForMed
description: YouthTeensForMed Medical Podcast Series aims to combat the misinformation and lack of information in the medical field and spread awareness about common and uncommon medical conditions.

title: MUCHA DOSIS
description:
Conecta con la esencia real de las relaciones en la atención médica con MUCHA DOSIS, el podcast de Clínica Foianini que ofrece una perspectiva profunda y transformadora.

En cada episodio, exploramos las historias inspiradoras de verdaderos héroes que dedican sus vidas a mejorar la salud y el bienestar de la comunidad.

Al suscribirse, tendrás la oportunidad de conocer y ver las relaciones en un entorno médico desde una nueva perspectiva.

¡No se conforme con lo superficial, sumerja su mente en esta experiencia regeneradora!
author_name: Clínica Foianini, compartiendo y creando juntos

title: Cancer Rebranded
description:
Hello and welcome to Cancer Rebranded. In 1992, I was diagnosed with brain cancer, a type of brain tumor usually seen in adolescents and young adults. My name is Craig Lustig and more than 30 years after hearing the words, “you have cancer,” I’m having conversations about what has changed in the cancer experience, what hasn’t and the work ahead.

When I meet newly diagnosed cancer patients, I encourage them, that regardless of their prognosis, remember that just because you have cancer, doesn’t mean that you are cancer. You have a family, friends, a community, a profession, hobbies and dreams. The impact of cancer is significant, but just because you have cancer, all of the elements that make you unique are still there.

This podcast aims to do a few things. First, take a big picture view of the cancer experience. Let’s talk about treatment decisions, side effects and clinical trials. But I also want to focus on questions like, what does it mean to be a young adult, a person of color, a queer person with cancer, an older person, a caregiver. In the US there are more than 18 million cancer survivors and growing. What does it mean to integrate the cancer experience into your life 1, 5, 10, 20 or 30 years after your diagnosis? These topics are complicated, because every person impacted by cancer is a unique and complex individual.

title: The Cure Chronicles
description:
Imagine a world without HIV. At Addimmune, we see that world as a very real possibility. We’re pursuing a potential cure for HIV using gene therapy, and we believe we could see the end of HIV in our lifetimes.

For people living with HIV, a cure would mean no more lifelong antiretroviral therapy, no fear of AIDS, and no possibility of being contagious.

On “The Cure Chronicles” Podcast, we take a deep look into the lives of extraordinary individuals – authors, comedians, doctors, community leaders, educators, advocates, and more – many with their own diagnoses, who are all striving toward the common goal of ending HIV.

‎

About Addimmune:

Addimmune is a clinical-stage, gene therapy company in Rockville, Maryland. Our mission is to harness the power of gene therapy to create a world without HIV.

title: Cocoa Pods Podcast
description:
Maternity talk. Women’s Healthcare talk

On Cocoa Pods Podcast,we discuss womens’ health issues beyond the doctor's office examination room ,beyond the operating room and with women’s real life experiences.

Now in season three,I invite you to listen to all our episodes.

I created Cocoa pods podcast for women and everyone involved in the health of a woman throughout her life cycle,hoping that talking about health care issues would educate women and bring to light answers to some of the questions they may have in their everyday health care journey.The hope is to also involve all stakeholders in womens healthcare in the discussion resulting in positive policy changes.

Indeed,I have the God-given knowledge, experience and expertise to address these issues and we just marked producing our 100th episode of Cocoa Pods podcast.

In season one of Cocoa Pods Podcast, we talked about several issues ranging from “a well-woman” visit especially from an obstetric point of view and how it provides an excellent opportunity to counsel women healthcare seekers or patients about maintaining a healthy lifestyle and minimizing health risks,to reasons why a woman would choose a home birth delivery.

We have had guests like Dr Nanette Wenger, who has done the most research in the United States on women’s cardiac health issues, to Dr Brad Bootstaylor, University of San Francisco- trained maternal fetal medicine specialist who is prevented from practicing his profession and not because of his lack of skill.

In season two of Cocoa Pods Podcast we talked about issues ranging from how women have sacrificed their bodies, endured pain and suffered willingly or unwillingly for science … for our better health; to all what it means to have a Cesarean section.

I’m excited that this March 2023, we kicked off season three of Cocoa Pods Podcast and we want to continue the story telling of information that will impact the lives of women and those who care about women.

We do hope you accept our invitation and tune in each and every Thursday to listen to Cocoa Pods podcast on all major podcast streaming platforms.

Thank you.

Dr Bola Sogade

Host of Cocoa Pods Podcast

title: The Pre-Rounds Podcast

Just like in pre-rounds, we’re trying to figure it out. We’re learning, we win some, and we lose some. But at the end of the day, we become one step closer to becoming ReAl DoCtOrs. The Pre-rounds podcast follows two medical students in their journey through medicine and whatever it hurls at them. This podcast is perfect for pre-meds, medical students, and residents who want to feel nostalgic. Join us as we grow (with pain), learn, develop in medicine, and cultivate community from our first year to our last year.

“Just like in Pre-rounding, we’re trying to figure it out.” - the med students.

We love you much

- Hana and Michael <3

title: El podcast de la FIGO
description: El podcast de la FIGO, organizado por la Federación Internacional de Ginecología y Obstetricia (FIGO), tiene como objetivo difundir recomendaciones clínicas a obstetras, ginecólogos y otros profesionales de la salud para ayudar a mejorar los resultados de salud de las mujeres y las niñas en todo el mundo. La FIGO tiene la visión de que las mujeres del mundo alcancen los niveles más altos posibles de salud y bienestar físico, mental, reproductivo y sexual durante toda su vida. La FIGO se dedica a la reducción de las disparidades en la atención sanitaria disponible para las mujeres y los recién nacidos, así como al avance de la ciencia y la práctica de la obstetricia y la ginecología. En este podcast utilizamos a menudo los términos "mujer", "niña" y "mujeres y niñas". Reconocemos que no todas las personas que necesitan acceder a los servicios ginecológicos y obstétricos se identifican como mujer o niña. Todas las personas, independientemente de su identidad de género, deben tener acceso a servicios y cuidados adecuados, inclusivos y sensibles.
author_name: Federación Internacional de Ginecología y Obstetricia (FIGO)

title: Le podcast de la FIGO
description: Le Podcast FIGO, organisé par la Fédération internationale de gynécologie et d'obstétrique (FIGO), vise à diffuser des recommandations cliniques aux obstétriciens, gynécologues et autres professionnels de la santé afin d'améliorer la santé des femmes et des jeunes filles dans le monde entier. La vision de la FIGO est que les femmes du monde entier atteignent le plus haut niveau possible de santé et de bien-être physique, mental, reproductif et sexuel tout au long de leur vie. La FIGO se consacre à la réduction des disparités dans les soins de santé offerts aux femmes et aux nouveau-nés, ainsi qu'à l'avancement de la science et de la pratique de l'obstétrique et de la gynécologie. Dans ce podcast, nous utilisons souvent les termes "femmes", "filles" et "femmes et filles". Nous reconnaissons que toutes les personnes qui ont besoin d'accéder à des services d'obstétrique et de gynécologie ne s'identifient pas comme des femmes ou des filles. Toutes les personnes, quelle que soit leur identité de genre, devraient avoir accès à des services et des soins appropriés, inclusifs et sensibles.
author_name: Fédération Internationale de Gynécologie et d'Obstétrique (FIGO)

title: The Heart Guardian: Podcasts for a healthy  heart
description:
The Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) Chair of Preventive Cardiology, in collaboration with the Madhavbaug Institute of Preventive Cardiology, has started a podcast series on cardiac health and preventing cardiac diseases. The podcast series is aimed at the general public and features Dr. Jagdish Hiremath, the Chairperson of Preventive Cardiology at MUHS, who discusses various topics related to heart health.

Dr. Hiremath is a renowned expert in the field of cardiology and has been actively involved in promoting preventive cardiology practices in India. Through this podcast series, he along with the other leading experts in the field of preventive cardiology , aim to educate people about the importance of maintaining a healthy heart and preventing cardiac diseases.

The podcast series, hosted by Dr Aman Kapoor , a dr with 20+ yrs experience in various sectors of healthcare including Digital Health covers a wide range of topics related to cardiac health, including risk factors for heart disease, lifestyle changes for a healthy heart, exercise and physical activity, healthy eating habits, stress management, and much more. The Language is simple and has real-life examples to explain complex medical concepts, making the podcast accessible and easy to understand for everyone.The podcast series has been to help raise awareness about the importance of preventive cardiology practices. By providing accurate and reliable information about heart health, the podcast series has helped many people take control of their health and make positive changes to their lifestyle.

The Podcast series hosted by Dr Aman Kapoor , started by the MUHS Chair of Preventive Cardiology and supported by the Madhavbaug Institute of Preventive Cardiology is an excellent initiative aimed at promoting cardiac health and preventing cardiac diseases. Dr. Jagdish S Hiremath's expertise and dedication to the field of cardiology have made this podcast series a valuable resource for anyone looking to improve their heart health. #Hearthealth #prevention #heartdiseaseprevention #lifestyledisorders #healthpodcast #DrJagdishHiremath #Madhavbaug #MUHS #AKonnects #DrAmanKapoor

title: Surviving HG: The Truth About Plant Medicine
description:
Join Canadian Podcast Host and HG Content Creator, Tori Moline (@goldenteachertori), as she takes a deep dive into an untalked about maternal health crisis Hyperemesis Gravidarum (HG). HG is a genetic pregnancy illness characterized by cyclical vomiting, malnutrition, weight loss and dehydration. It's an uphill battle and can often take years to heal from. Many medical professionals do not know about HG. Many mom's are treated poorly in doctor/hospital care while barely surviving and growing a baby. The current solutions being offered to HG mom's are not working and having short/long term consequences. Some brave women have found a glimmer of hope in a highly stigmatized (sometimes illegal!) anti-nauseant plant during this time; cannabis.

For centuries, HG pregnancies have often gone undiagnosed, misdiagnosed, and/or in some cases, congratulated because of maternal weight loss. History tells us that pregnant women have been silenced for a very long time. History tells us that pregnant women have not been given the space, community, or resources that allow them to thrive. History tells us that HG mom's have been the biggest victim's of this.

HG mom's have not received proper care for generations. HG mom's who have faced HG pregnancies have rarely been given education, resources, or appropriate care.

Cannabis laws vary state to state and country to country. The barrier to many HG mom's is access. It is inhumane that HG mom's are drug tested at birth and persecuted according to their state laws/hospital policies for trying to survive HG.

16 raw stories capturing HG and it's multi-layered wrath... 16 women's stories illustrating a maternal health crisis... 16 HG mom's who bravely chose cannabis.

We tackle a different medical topic in every episode, blending laughter with learning. Join us for expert insights served with a side of humor! Whether you're a healthcare pro, total hypochondriac, or just love to LOL, Funny Medicine delivers feel-good fun. Search "funny medical podcast" now to start enjoying their comedic chemotherapy! Hit follow for your daily dose of medical mirth! #MedicalComedy #FunnyMedicinePodcast #HealthHumor #LaughAndLearn"

title: ¿Yoga o Clonazepam?
description:
Este podcast está diseñado para darte acceso a la información y las herramientas que necesitas para mejorar tu salud mental, tomar mejores decisiones en tu tratamiento, y en tu día a día.

Conocer la información científica más actualizada es clave para aprender a cuidar nuestra mente y entender la variedad de estrategias que podemos implementar a nuestra vida para sentirnos mejor.

A través de entrevistas a expertos, este podcast analizará el potencial -y las limitaciones- de diversos tratamientos alternativos y convencionales que buscan curar diversos síntomas como depresión, ansiedad, problemas para dormir y otros trastornos psicosomáticos: Desde la Fibromialgia hasta la gastritis, migrañas, fatiga crónica, cansancio, colon irritable y la interminable variedad de síntomas que aparecen en el cuerpo por el estrés.

title: ADOLESCENT360
description:
Adolescent360, un programa multitemático y de actualidad donde se aborda la adolescencia en toda su complejidad. El programa de radio dedicado a hablar sobre temas de salud y bienestar, especialmente diseñados para jóvenes como tú y tus familiares, en el que estaremos explorando los desafíos y oportunidades que enfrentan los adolescentes en cuanto a su salud física, emocional y mental. Mándanos un WhatsApp o audio al +34 644 099 112 y comparte tus dudas y opinión con nosotros. ¡Prepara tus oídos y tu mente, porque vamos a hablar de salud, y hablar de salud es hablar de ti!

title: Modern Mom's Wellness Podcast
description:
Welcome to Modern Mom's Wellness Podcast with Jenna Johnston CNS, MSCN and Renata Filiaci MSHW, CD (DONA). We are here to discuss with you all things motherhood, whether it be fertility, pregnancy, postpartum, or the journey through the process with an abundance of resources, emotional support, guidance, and experts. We are starting this podcast to share simple and practical ways that moms can support their physical and mental health during pregnancy and the years postpartum through the use of nutrition, supplements, herbal medicine, and lifestyle factors like sleep, stress management, movement, etc. so they can feel fully nourished during this transformative time in their lives. By incorporating conventional medicine with alternative medicine, we want to show they can both coexist together, and it doesn't have to be black or white.

We are catering to the moms who are looking for something that's quick and easy to understand and also offers them practical ways to include these suggestions into their lives (i.e., tips and tricks). One of our goals is to empower mothers to take care of their health because that means they can better care for their families and, in the long run, it will improve their children's health too.

Disclaimer: This podcast and social media presence represents the opinions of Jenna Johnston and Renata Filiaci and their guests on the show and social media platforms. This content should not be taken as medical advice as we do not treat, prescribe, diagnose, or cure through our practices. The content here is for informational purposes only, and because each person is so unique, please consult your healthcare professional for any medical questions.

We have no current affiliations at the moment and all opinions expressed belong to those who are sharing them.

We do NOT endorse, condone, or advocate the use of drugs/substances on this podcast. We consider ourselves a harm reduction resource and encourage anybody struggling with addiction to seek help immediately.

Hope you enjoy while we continue to get our footing in this crazy digital world!

title: TLDR: Veterinary Podcast
description:
Title:

TLDR: Your Go-To Podcast for Bite-Sized Pet Health Insights

Episode Title:

Simplify Science, One Wag at a Time: Welcome to TLDR!

Introduction:

Welcome to the inaugural episode of TLDR: Too Long, Didn't Research! If you're a busy veterinary professional or a pet owner seeking quick, engaging insights into the world of veterinary science, you're in for a treat. In this episode, we'll introduce you to the TLDR podcast and explain how we're revolutionizing the way you approach your pet's well-being.

Episode Highlights:

- Problem Solved: We dive into the common struggles of staying informed about pet health amidst a sea of complex information and jargon.

- Introducing TLDR: Discover how TLDR is your shortcut to staying savvy. We break down the latest veterinary research into easily digestible snippets, minus the overwhelm.

- Unique Approach: Learn how TLDR stands out from the crowd. We combine research with a touch of fun, making it feel like a friendly chat with your favorite vet.

- Real Results: Hear heartwarming stories of Max and Bella – real pets whose lives improved thanks to TLDR's insights.

- Join the Community: Explore why leading vets and pet parents trust TLDR. We've garnered recognition as a top pet podcast, and we're ready to welcome you into our community.

- Engage with Us: We wrap up with an invitation for you to join the TLDR journey. Dive into episodes and empower your pet care routine with actionable research.

Key Takeaways:

1. Staying informed about pet health doesn't have to be overwhelming or boring.

2. TLDR is your research-obsessed friend, making veterinary science accessible and enjoyable.

3. Real stories prove the impact of TLDR's insights on pets' lives.

4. Trust TLDR as your go-to source for credible, concise pet health information.

Engaging Question:

Are you ready to make pet well-being a breeze? How will TLDR's insights transform your approach to caring for your furry companion?

Tune in to TLDR and let's simplify science, one wag at a time! Subscribe now for more wag-worthy wisdom.

Disclaimer: The information provided in this podcast is for educational and informational purposes only. Always consult a qualified veterinarian for personalized advice on your pet's health.
